ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Readings in Himalayan Buddhism is a course on the adaptation and development of traditions along Himalayan border regions. There is intense questioning about what defines the "Himalaya" as well as about what defines a politico-cultural center versus a border, and there is a good deal of theoretically rich ethnographic material explored and discussed. Research projects of the student's own devising are developed throughout the semester with Andy's help.
Yes, this is a great course. This is not an intro course but if you have taken previous courses on topic, I reccomend you take it.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The ethnographic material deals with the cultures I am interested in in my work, and the theoretical frameworks and issues raised were very useful in thinking about those cultures. I'm quite sure I will return to several of the readings in my work going forward, and my project has helped frame my interests for future dissertation work.
